duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform a wide variety of patient care activities in an assigned specialty or subspecialty outpatient clinic under the direction of a staff nurse and/or physician.
Record accurate vital signs and measurements, assist with exams and procedures.
Collaborate with health care team members to ensure patient needs are met and clinic operations are efficient.
Manage refill requests and administer medications to patients following policies and procedures.
Identify patient needs for referrals and implement teaching plans for patients and their families.
Serve as a leader in providing excellent service to patients by welcoming them warmly and ensuring clear and accurate communication.
Assist Nurse Manager in ensuring all team members meet service standards and follow department guidelines.
Identify needs for improvement and opportunities to recognize excellence in the performance of all team members.
Work under usual clinic conditions, necessitating a high degree of contact with patients, families, and clinic personnel.
Work directly with a provider and record in "real time," facts and events that occur between a patient and a provider as a scribe.

education_certification.credential: Completion of a Board of Nursing accredited program of vocational nursing. Current Vocational Nursing license in the state of Texas or the attainment of a temporary permit to practice vocational nursing pending full licensure in the state of Texas.
